title: ICE after rust update

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
We run travis CRON jobs over our master branch in this [repository](https://github.com/googlecartographer/point_cloud_viewer). This started failing 2 days ago for rust beta and rust nightly (rust stable is still green). Since travis did not change anything, no commits happened, and it neatly coincides with a rust train leaving, I suspect rust to be the culprit. It could also be in prost, so I filed https://github.com/danburkert/prost/issues/67. Unfortunately, I cannot repro the ICE on my Mac machine.

CI ICEs after building and when running this [build script](https://github.com/googlecartographer/point_cloud_viewer/blob/master/build.rs) that compiles a protobuf using prost. 

This is the [first failing run](https://travis-ci.org/googlecartographer/point_cloud_viewer/builds/324675226) and this is the [last successful run](https://travis-ci.org/googlecartographer/point_cloud_viewer/builds/323822120) 4 days ago.

The versions used in the successful beta run are:
~~~
rustc 1.23.0-beta.2 (c9107ee93 2017-12-08)
$ rustup --version
rustup 1.8.0 (cb2d14862 2017-12-17)
$ cargo --version
cargo 0.24.0-beta (6a1aee066 2017-11-18)
~~~

The versions used in the failing beta run are:
~~~
rustc 1.24.0-beta.1 (5b496b726 2018-01-02)
$ rustup --version
rustup 1.8.0 (cb2d14862 2017-12-17)
$ cargo --version
cargo 0.25.0-beta (a88fbace4 2017-12-29)
~~~

The nightly CI will probably have tighter version bounds.
